page.title: 13OGBOURNE:FARMS 50 YEARS AGO
page.content: { Fifty years ago}most of the men and boys worked on one of the{five farms in the parish, earning at most thirty shillings a week.Boys would begin bird-scaring or taking the cows out to pasture, then they would work with the big flocks of sheep or the horses. There were twenty or thirty big working horses who did all the ploughing and pulling the carts.Some steam engines were used, but most machinery was horse drawn. Work started at six in winter and five in the summer and at harvest time went on until it was dark, a long day for the fourteen year old school leavers. Shepherds would walk miles with the flocks across the Downs, with a dog for company.
